org.apache.karaf.shell.api.action

Annotation Type Option


  • @Retention(value=RUNTIME)
 @Target(value=FIELD)
public @interface Option

    Used to mark an optional named command line option who's name typically starts with "--" or "-". This annotation can be applied to attributes of a class implementing an Action. The value of the command line option will be automatically converted to the attribute type.

    See Also:

    Example 1 (boolean option):

    @Option(name="--force") boolean force;

    This will be represented as --force on the command line.

    Example 2 (mandatory String option):

    @Option(name="-name",required=true) String name;

    This will be represented as -name=<myname> on the command line and the command will be rejected if the option is not given.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Fields and Description
      static java.lang.String DEFAULT_STRING 

    • Required Element Summary

      Required Elements 
      Modifier and Type Required Element and Description

    • Field Detail

      • DEFAULT_STRING

        public static final java.lang.String DEFAULT_STRING

    • Element Detail

      • name

        public abstract java.lang.String name
        The name of this option. Usually starting with a '-'.
        Returns:
        the option name.

      • aliases

        public abstract java.lang.String[] aliases
        Specify a list of aliases for this option. Useful when using an option with short or long names.
        Returns:
        the option aliases (as a string array).
        Default:
        {}

      • description

        public abstract java.lang.String description
        A textual description of the option.
        Returns:
        the option description.
        Default:
        ""

      • required

        public abstract boolean required
        Whether this argument is mandatory or not.
        Returns:
        true if the option is required, false else.
        Default:
        false

      • multiValued

        public abstract boolean multiValued
        The last argument can be multi-valued in which case the field type must be a List. On the command line, multi-valued options are used with specifying the option multiple times with different values.
        Returns:
        true if the option is multivalued, false else.
        Default:
        false

      • valueToShowInHelp

        public abstract java.lang.String valueToShowInHelp
        The generated help displays default values for arguments. In case the value displayed in the help to the user should be different that the default value of the field, one can use this property to specify the value to display.
        Returns:
        the option description as shown in the help.
        Default:
        "DEFAULT"

      • censor

        public abstract boolean censor
        Censor the argument in the console. Characters will be replaced with Argument.mask(). This is useful for hiding sensitive data like passwords.
        Returns:
        true if the argument should be censored in the console.
        Default:
        false

      • mask

        public abstract char mask
        Character to use when censoring the argument in the console.
        Returns:
        the Character to use when censoring the argument in the console.
        Default:
        42
